definition: to take time off/to take leave (e.g. for study)/to skive off work
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to leave one's post during working hours
to abscond/to be absent without leave
to leave early (before the stipulated finishing time)/to retire early (from one's job)
to be absent from work or school
to replace sb on a workshift/to substitute for
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
to go to work/to be present (at work, school etc)/to be away on business
time of going to work/the morning rush hour
(of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
breach of responsibility/failure to carry out one's duty
